speaker: DULL
text: Which is the Duke’s own person?

speaker: BEROWNE
text: This, fellow. What wouldst?

speaker: DULL
text: I myself reprehend his own person, for I am his

speaker: DULL
text: Grace’s farborough. But I would see his own

speaker: DULL
text: person in flesh and blood.

speaker: BEROWNE
text: This is he.

speaker: DULL
text: Signior Arm-, Arm-, commends you.

speaker: DULL
text: There’s villainy abroad. This letter will tell you

speaker: DULL
text: more.

speaker: COSTARD
text: Sir, the contempts thereof are as touching

speaker: COSTARD
text: me.

speaker: KING
text: A letter from the magnificent Armado.

speaker: BEROWNE
text: How low soever the matter, I hope in God

speaker: BEROWNE
text: for high words.

speaker: LONGAVILLE
text: A high hope for a low heaven. God grant

speaker: LONGAVILLE
text: us patience!

speaker: BEROWNE
text: To hear, or forbear hearing?

speaker: LONGAVILLE
text: To hear meekly, sir, and to laugh moderately,

speaker: LONGAVILLE
text: or to forbear both.

speaker: BEROWNE
text: Well, sir, be it as the style shall give us cause

speaker: BEROWNE
text: to climb in the merriness.

speaker: COSTARD
text: The matter is to me, sir, as concerning

speaker: COSTARD
text: Jaquenetta. The manner of it is, I was taken with

speaker: COSTARD
text: the manner.

speaker: BEROWNE
text: In what manner?

speaker: COSTARD
text: In manner and form following, sir, all those

speaker: COSTARD
text: three. I was seen with her in the manor house,

speaker: COSTARD
text: sitting with her upon the form, and taken following

speaker: COSTARD
text: her into the park, which, put together, is “in manner

speaker: COSTARD
text: and form following.” Now, sir, for the manner.

speaker: COSTARD
text: It is the manner of a man to speak to a woman. For

speaker: COSTARD
text: the form—in some form.

speaker: BEROWNE
text: For the “following,” sir?

speaker: COSTARD
text: As it shall follow in my correction, and God

speaker: COSTARD
text: defend the right.

speaker: KING
text: Will you hear this letter with attention?

speaker: BEROWNE
text: As we would hear an oracle.

speaker: COSTARD
text: Such is the sinplicity of man to hearken after

speaker: COSTARD
text: the flesh.

speaker: BEROWNE
text: This is not so well as I looked for, but the

speaker: BEROWNE
text: best that ever I heard.

speaker: KING
text:
Ay, the best, for the worst.
                 
                To
                 
                Costard
                .
               But,

speaker: KING
text: sirrah, what say you to this?

speaker: COSTARD
text: Sir, I confess the wench.

speaker: KING
text: Did you hear the proclamation?

speaker: COSTARD
text: I do confess much of the hearing it, but little

speaker: COSTARD
text: of the marking of it.

speaker: KING
text: It was proclaimed a year’s imprisonment to be

speaker: KING
text: taken with a wench.

speaker: COSTARD
text: I was taken with none, sir. I was taken with a

speaker: COSTARD
text: damsel.

speaker: KING
text: Well, it was proclaimed “damsel.”

speaker: COSTARD
text: This was no damsel neither, sir. She was a

speaker: COSTARD
text: virgin.

speaker: BEROWNE
text: It is so varied too, for it was proclaimed

speaker: BEROWNE
text: “virgin.”

speaker: COSTARD
text: If it were, I deny her virginity. I was taken

speaker: COSTARD
text: with a maid.

speaker: KING
text: This “maid” will not serve your turn, sir.

speaker: COSTARD
text: This maid will serve my turn, sir.

speaker: KING
text: Sir, I will pronounce your sentence: you shall

speaker: KING
text: fast a week with bran and water.

speaker: COSTARD
text: I had rather pray a month with mutton and

speaker: COSTARD
text: porridge.

speaker: KING
text: And Don Armado shall be your keeper.

speaker: KING
text:
My
               
              Lord
               
              Berowne
              ,

              o’er
              ,

speaker: COSTARD
text: I suffer for the truth, sir; for true it is I was

speaker: COSTARD
text: taken with Jaquenetta, and Jaquenetta is a true

speaker: COSTARD
text: girl. And therefore welcome the sour cup of prosperity.

speaker: COSTARD
text: Affliction may one day smile again, and till

speaker: COSTARD
text: then, sit thee down, sorrow.
